item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, January 30, 2025 at 1:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Exposed DeepSeek database leaking sensitive information, including chat history (288 points | 162 comments)
2. An analysis of DeepSeek's R1-Zero and R1 (363 points | 151 comments)
3. Blueskyfeedbot: Post RSS Feeds to Bluesky via GitHub Actions (16 points | 6 comments)
4. SmolGPT: A minimal PyTorch implementation for training a small LLM from scratch (191 points | 25 comments)
5. Building a T1D smartwatch for my son from scratch (175 points | 25 comments)
6. Etleap (YC W13) Is Hiring a Senior Software Engineer (SF) ( | hide)
7. OpenAI says it has evidence DeepSeek used its model to train competitor (399 points | 1172 comments)
8. Advice for a friend who wants to start a blog (47 points | 21 comments)
9. From C++ to Clojure: Jank language promises best of both (55 points | 12 comments)
10. An update on Dart macros and data serialization (104 points | 81 comments)
11. Soviet Shoe Factory Principle (75 points | 56 comments)
12. Parsing PDFs (and more) in Elixir using Rust (48 points | 8 comments)
13. A major Postgres upgrade with zero downtime (90 points | 33 comments)
14. Meta Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Results (35 points | 24 comments)
15. Bacteria (and their metabolites) and depression (382 points | 169 comments)
16. Keymapper: A cross-platform context-aware key remapper (35 points | 10 comments)
17. Cognitive Reasoning Agents and the Extended Information Filter (12 points | 1 comment)
18. Case Study: ByteDance Uses eBPF to Enhance Networking Performance (101 points | 12 comments)
19. Asteroid Impact on Earth 2032 with Probability 1% and 8Mt Energy (190 points | 169 comments)
20. Airflow – Stream media files directly from macOS to AirPlay devices (56 points | 23 comments)
21. Ötzi the Lyme Mummy (2019) (64 points | 22 comments)
22. Making the video that made Gorillaz (139 points | 31 comments)
23. Cardan grille (31 points | discuss)
24. Dead Games (112 points | 40 comments)
25. Society for Technical Communication to permanently close its doors (70 points | 20 comments)
26. I still like Sublime Text (958 points | 505 comments)
27. Showkey: Examine Keyboard Codes (4 points | discuss)
28. "We're building a new static type checker for Python" (245 points | 123 comments)
29. Adding iodine to salt played a role in cognitive improvements: research (2013) (185 points | 129 comments)
30. A story about restoring and upgrading a Commodore Amiga 1000 (121 points | 33 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, January 30, 2025 at 1:10 AM UTC
